title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-7.3 - Average nontuition costs of attendance
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-7.3 - Average nontuition costs of attendance

State Regulations

The commissioner, in consultation with the President of
the Higher Education Services Corporation and subject to the approval by the

Director of the Budget, shall determine each year the average of all nontuition
costs of attendance at the State University of New York to be used for
full-time and part-time students, as those costs relate to the Liberty

Scholarship Program. The regular academic year room and board liberty
allowances shall be determined each year by the commissioner based on
information certified by the State University of New York no later than July
1st preceding the regular academic year. The components of the average
nontuition costs of attendance are the costs of room and board, transportation, and books and supplies. Each component shall be determined as follows: (a) Room and board liberty allowance. (1)

Full-time students: (i) Resident student (public institutions). The room and board liberty allowance shall be the lesser of (a) the cost of a
double room and full meal plan (if offered) at the institution attended, or (b)
the actual room and board charge to the student for the period of attendance. If an institutional meal plan is not offered, the liberty allowance for board
shall be the average cost of a full meal plan at the State University of New

York for the period of attendance. (ii)

Resident student (nonpublic
institutions). The room and board liberty allowance shall be the lesser of (a)
the average cost of a double room and full meal plan at the State University of

New York, or (b) the actual room and board charge to the student for the period
of attendance. If an institutional meal plan is not offered, the liberty
allowance for board shall be the average cost of a full meal plan at the State

University of New York for the period of attendance. (iii)

Off-campus student (public
institutions). The room and board liberty allowance shall be the average cost
of a double room and full meal plan at the institution attended for the period
of attendance. If room is not offered at the institution attended, the liberty
allowance for room shall be the average cost of a double room at the State

University of New York for the period of attendance. If an institutional meal
plan is not offered at the institution attended, the liberty allowance for
board shall be the average cost of a full meal plan at the State University of

New York for the period of attendance. (iv)

Off-campus student (nonpublic
institutions). The room and board liberty allowance shall be the lesser of (a)
the average cost of a double room and full meal plan at the State University of

New York, or (b) the average cost of a double room and full meal plan at the
institution attended for the period of attendance. If room is not offered at
the institution attended, the average cost of a double room at the State

University of New York shall be used to determine the liberty allowance for
room for the period of attendance. If an institutional meal plan is not offered
at the institution attended, the average cost of a full meal plan at the State

University of New York shall be used to determine the liberty allowance for
board for the period of attendance. (v) Commuter student. The regular academic
year room and board liberty allowance for a student residing with parent(s), or
in a dwelling owned or rented by his or her parents, shall be the average cost
of a full meal plan at the State University of New York. The regular academic
year room and board liberty allowance for a student not residing with
parent(s), or in a dwelling owned or rented by his or her parents, shall be the
average cost of a full meal plan at the State University of New York plus the
difference under the Federal Pell Program between the amount provided to a
student without dependents residing at home with parent(s) and the amount
provided to any other student. The weekly room and board liberty allowance for
accelerated term students shall be one-thirtieth of the next regular academic
year room and board liberty allowance for commuter students at the institution
attended. (2)

Part-time
students. The regular academic year room and board liberty allowance for all
part-time students shall be the average cost of a full meal plan at the State

University of New York. The weekly room and board liberty allowances for
accelerated term students shall be the weekly average cost of a full-meal plan
at the State University of New York for the period attended. (b) Transportation liberty
allowance. The regular academic year transportation liberty allowances for
full-time and part-time "resident, off-campus and commuter" students at
institutions of The City University of New York and the State University of New

York shall be determined each year by the commissioner based on information
certified by the respective universities no later than November 1st preceding
the award year. The regular academic year transportation liberty allowances for
students at all other institutions shall be the average student financial aid
transportation allowances at the State University of New York. The weekly
transportation liberty allowances for accelerated term shall be one-thirtieth
of the next regular academic year transportation liberty allowances at the
institution attended. (c) Books and
supplies liberty allowance. (1)

Full-time
students. The regular academic year books and supplies liberty allowance for
all full-time students shall be determined each year by the commissioner based
on information certified by the State University of New York no later than

November 1st preceding the award year. The books and supplies liberty allowance
for a full- time accelerated term student shall be one-half the next regular
academic year full-time student books and supplies liberty allowance at the
institution attended. (2)

Part-time
students. The regular academic year books and supplies liberty allowance for a
three-quarter-time student (enrolled for at least nine but less than 12
semester hours) shall be 75 percent of the amount for full-time students. The
books and supplies liberty allowance for a three-quarter-time accelerated term
student shall be 50 percent of the next regular academic year
three-quarter-time student books and supplies liberty allowance at the
institution attended. The regular academic year books and supplies liberty
allowance for half-time students (enrolled for at least six but less than nine
semester hours) shall be 50 percent of the amount for full-time students. The
books and supplies liberty allowance for a half-time accelerated term student
shall be 50 percent of the next regular academic year half-time student books
and supplies liberty allowance at the institution attended. Notes
